page.title: 14A farmworkers day
page.content: 'It's 7.00am and time to get up and ready for work. I have some breakfast and let the dogs out. I arrive at the farm at about 8.00am. We feed the livestock and get the machinery ready for work. The dogs come to the farm everyday. We start work on the land at about 10.00am. At the moment I'm mostly baling hay or spraying. When we bale hay it takes about three hours depending on the size of the field. I drive an Internatational 685xl. It has a 72hp engine.After I have baled the field we load the hay onto trailers and stack them in the dutch barns. We go home for dinner at 12.00pm and go back to work at 1.00pm. During the dinner hour I sometimes cut the lawns and tidy up. After dinner I often go to spray.
